member.param: The message to be dispatched. You cannot modify this message.

member.name: T:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.Win32API
member.summary: Static class for Native Win32 methods and corresponding structures.
member.remarks:
This is a grouping of any API calls regularly used by Gorgon.
This list is by no means complete. The Win32 API is just massive and would probably take a lifetime to map.
These calls are considered "unsafe" and thus should be used with care. If you don't know how to use a function, or why you want it, you probably don't need to use them.
Please note that a lot of the enumerators/structures have slightly different names than their Win32 counterparts. This was done for the sake of readability. This does NOT affect their results or their effect on the results of their related functionality.

member.name: M:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.Win32API.joyGetThreshold(System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Function to retrieve the dead zone of the joystick.

member.name: M:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.Win32API.joyGetNumDevs
member.summary: Function to return the number of joystick devices supported by the current driver.
member.returns: Number of joysticks supported, 0 if no driver is installed.

member.name: M:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.Win32API.joyGetDevCaps(System.Int32,GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.JOYCAPS@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Function to return the joystick device capabilities.
member.param: ID of the joystick to return. -1 will return registry key, whether a device exists or not.
Size of the JOYCAPS structure in bytes.
member.returns: 0 if successful, non zero if not.

member.name: M:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.Win32API.joyGetPos(System.Int32,GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.JOYINFO@)
member.summary: Function to retrieve joystick position information.
member.param: ID the of joystick to query.
member.returns: 0 if successful, non zero if not. JOYERR_UNPLUGGED if not connected.

member.name: M:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.Win32API.joyGetPosEx(System.Int32,GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.JOYINFOEX@)
member.summary: Function to retrieve joystick position information.
member.param: ID the of joystick to query.
member.returns: 0 if successful, non zero if not. JOYERR_UNPLUGGED if not connected.

member.name: M:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.Win32API.GetRawInputData(System.IntPtr,GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RawInputCommand,GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RAWINPUTx86@,System.Int32@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Function to retrieve raw input data.
member.param: Command to issue when retrieving data.
Number of bytes in the array.
member.returns: 0 if successful if pData is null, otherwise number of bytes if pData is not null.

member.name: M:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.Win32API.GetRawInputData(System.IntPtr,GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RawInputCommand,GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RAWINPUTx64@,System.Int32@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Function to retrieve raw input data.
member.param: Command to issue when retrieving data.
Number of bytes in the array.
member.returns: 0 if successful if pData is null, otherwise number of bytes if pData is not null.

member.summary: Function to retrieve raw input data.
member.param: Command to issue when retrieving data.
Number of bytes in the array.
member.returns: 0 if successful if pData is null, otherwise number of bytes if pData is not null.

member.summary: Top level collection Usage page for the raw input device.

member.summary: Top level collection Usage for the raw input device.

member.summary: Relative direction of motion, depending on flags.

member.name: F:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RAWINPUTMOUSE.LastY
member.summary: Relative direction of motion, depending on flags.

member.name: T:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.RawInputEventArgs
member.summary: Object representing event arguments for the raw input events.

member.name: P:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.RawInputEventArgs.Data
member.summary: Property to return the raw input data.

member.name: T:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.RawInputEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate for a raw input event.

member.name: T:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.JoystickInfoFlags
member.summary: Enumeration containing the joystick information flags.

member.name: F:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.JoystickCapabilities.POVContinuousDegreeBearings
member.summary: Has a continuous degree bearing POV hat.

member.name: T:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.HIDUsagePage
member.summary: Enumeration containing HID usage page flags.

member.name: T:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RawInputDeviceFlags
member.summary: Enumeration containing flags for a raw input device.

member.name: F:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RawInputDeviceFlags.Remove
member.summary: If set, this removes the top level collection from the inclusion list. This tells the operating system to stop reading from a device which matches the top level collection.

member.name: F:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RawInputDeviceFlags.Exclude
member.summary: If set, this specifies the top level collections to exclude when reading a complete usage page. This flag only affects a TLC whose usage page is already specified with PageOnly.

member.name: F:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RawInputDeviceFlags.PageOnly
member.summary: If set, this specifies all devices whose top level collection is from the specified usUsagePage. Note that Usage must be zero. To exclude a particular top level collection, use Exclude.

member.name: F:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RawInputDeviceFlags.NoLegacy
member.summary: If set, this prevents any devices specified by UsagePage or Usage from generating legacy messages. This is only for the mouse and keyboard.

member.name: F:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RawInputDeviceFlags.InputSink
member.summary: If set, this enables the caller to receive the input even when the caller is not in the foreground. Note that WindowHandle must be specified.

member.name: F:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RawInputDeviceFlags.CaptureMouse
member.summary: If set, the mouse button click does not activate the other window.

member.name: F:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RawInputDeviceFlags.NoHotKeys
member.summary: If set, the application-defined keyboard device hotkeys are not handled. However, the system hotkeys; for example, ALT+TAB and CTRL+ALT+DEL, are still handled. By default, all keyboard hotkeys are handled. NoHotKeys can be specified even if NoLegacy is not specified and WindowHandle is NULL.

member.name: F:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RawInputDeviceFlags.AppKeys
member.summary: If set, application keys are handled. NoLegacy must be specified. Keyboard only.

member.name: T:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RawInputType
member.summary: Enumeration containing the type device the raw input is coming from.

member.name: F:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RawInputType.HID
member.summary: Another device that is not the keyboard or the mouse.

member.name: T:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RawMouseFlags
member.summary: Enumeration containing the flags for raw mouse data.

member.name: F:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RawMouseFlags.VirtualDesktop
member.summary: Coordinate data is mapped to a virtual desktop.

member.name: F:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RawMouseFlags.AttributesChanged
member.summary: Attributes for the mouse have changed.

member.name: T:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RawMouseButtons
member.summary: Enumeration containing the button data for raw mouse input.

member.name: T:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RawKeyboardFlags
member.summary: Enumeration containing flags for raw keyboard input.

member.name: T:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RawInputCommand
member.summary: Enumeration contanining the command types to issue.

member.name: F:GorgonLibrary.InputDevices.Internal.RawInputCommand.DeviceName
member.summary: Only return the device name, return value means number of characters, not bytes.

member.summary: Types of messages that passed to a window.
member.remarks: See the MSDN documentation for more detail.
